org.modelio.api.diagram

Interface IDiagramLink

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDiagramGraphic

    public interface IDiagramLink
extends IDiagramGraphic
    This class represents a DiagramGraphic of the 'link' kind.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IDiagramLink.LinkRouterKind
      Available connection routers.

    • Method Detail

      • getFont

        String getFont()
        Get the current font, represented by font data.

        A valid font data representation is a string of the form fontname-style-height where fontname is the name of a font, style is a font style (one of "regular", "bold", "italic", or "bold italic") and height is an integer representing the font height. Example: Times New Roman-bold-36.


        Might return null if the corresponding style key isn't defined.
        Returns:
        The font.

      • getFrom

        IDiagramGraphic getFrom()
        Returns:
        the source DiagramGraphic of the current Link.

        - 0 : Line drawing style for solid lines

        - 3 : Line drawing style for alternating dash-dot lines
        - 4 : Line drawing style for dash-dot-dot lines

      • getPath

        ILinkPath getPath()
        Return the path of the current link.

        The returned path is a snapshot of the current path and may freely be modified.

        To apply changes, call setPath(ILinkPath) with the modified path as parameter.

        Returns:
        The LinkPath that represent the path of the current link.

        Parameters:

      • setFont

        void setFont(String value)
             throws org.eclipse.jface.resource.DataFormatException
        Modify the current font.

        This method fails if the value does not represent font data.

        A valid font data representation is a string of the form fontname-style-height where fontname is the name of a font, style is a font style (one of "regular", "bold", "italic", or "bold italic") and height is an integer representing the font height. Example: Times New Roman-bold-36.

        Parameters:
        value - The new font.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.jface.resource.DataFormatException - if the given value does not represent font data

      • setLineColor

        void setLineColor(String value)
        Modify the current line color.
        Parameters:
        value - The new line color.

        void setLinePattern(int value)
        Modify the current line pattern.

        - 1 : Line drawing style for dashed lines
        - 2 : Line drawing style for dotted lines
        - 3 : Line drawing style for alternating dash-dot lines
        - 4 : Line drawing style for dash-dot-dot lines
        Parameters:

      • setPath

        void setPath(Collection<org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.Point> points)
        Route the path of a link.

        This method computes a path so that the link goes through the whole list of points. If the router referenced by the current Link is an orthogonal router the path will have orthogonal angles. If the router referenced by the current Link is a direct router this method is equivalent to the setPath method.

        Parameters:
        points - A collection of points that must be on the link path.

      • setPath

        void setPath(ILinkPath linkPath)
             throws InvalidSourcePointException,
                    InvalidPointsPathException,
                    InvalidDestinationPointException
        This method tries to set the current link path.
        Parameters:
        linkPath - The new path to use for this link.
        Throws:
        InvalidSourcePointException - If the source point is invalid.
        InvalidPointsPathException - If the given path is invalid with the router type associated with the current link.
        InvalidDestinationPointException - If the destination point is invalid.

      • setRouterKind

        void setRouterKind(IDiagramLink.LinkRouterKind routerKind)
        Modify the router referenced by the link.
        Parameters:
        routerKind - The new router kind for this link.

      • getElement

        MObject getElement()
        Description copied from interface: IDiagramGraphic
        Get the element this IDiagramGraphic is related to.

        Note: May return null if the element is not resolved. or the graphic does not represent a model element, such as diagram drawings..

        Specified by:
        getElement in interface IDiagramGraphic
        Returns:
        the represented element or null if the element is not resolved.
